intro: Calvaria, commonly known as the "crown of the forest," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. Calvaria species are typically shrubs or small trees, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
